CatDescriptText: Mr. James V. D'Alessandro, 449 Parkview Drive, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, November 30, 1957, pg. 3 with question: "Does the financial aid, given young married couples by parents, encourage or dissuade the latter's realization of marital responsibilities?" Answer reads: "To an extent it is good, and to an extent it is bad. I say that too much is bad and enough is all right."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of James V. D'Alessandro wearing fedora with dark band, diagonally striped necktie, and light colored overcoat, posed between store windows, one on left with posted article reading "Speaking of Beauty...Gus Brunn," one on right inscribed "B & B...travel..."
